intro: Diflugossa capillipes, commonly known as the slender feather moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hair-like leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks at the tips of the stems. Diflugossa capillipes plays an important role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
